Author: far33d
Content:
Agreed. Sometimes the same behavior, implemented with slightly different intentions, can have vastly different effects.

nickb isn't far from a link spammer - he might very well be detected as one by a poor algorithm on a lesser site. Instead he's an incredibly important contributor.

On the other hand, I too have suspected that he was just a really well trained bot - which would still be impressive.

Author: trevelyan
Content:
Keynes pretty much demonstrated that the feast/famine metaphor doesn't apply to economics.

imho, the real mess is going to happen when the American public realizes that social security is possibly the least insolvent government program, but that its ongoing surpluses have been handed out in tax cuts and war profiteering.

I'm still stunned Gore lost.

Author: r7000
Title: Every Stock Photo Online - search engine for free photos

Author: aswanson
Title: Ask news.yc:  Should the gov't let the current crisis self-correct?
Content: Offhand, it seems to me that the current liquidity crisis is the result of government market interference (artificially cheap credit) and the attempt to fix it is based on creating more cheap money.  Shouldn't market forces be allowed to clean out and correct?

Author: edw519
Content:
I had no idea. That was too good. (Except the bit about being picked last for dodgeball was hitting a little below the belt).

I'm glad I saw that. Now destroy that link forever.

Author: anewaccountname
Content: Don't forget that if you use the GPLv3 you won't be able to distribute your software with the OLPC, since it has anti-theft measures which put signed code at an advantage to unsigned.

Author: jsmcgd
Content: I thought of posting a similar question before because you seemed to be responsible for 1 in 6 of everything that happens on the site. I'm surprised to hear you actually get other stuff done. For a while I was starting to suspect you might be a professional Hacker News researcher!
